subSections.title: Kanji
Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|alligator|mul=crocodile}} [[Image:Alligator.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鰐}} (''wani''): a '''[[crocodile]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わに}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=わに}}. Derivation uncertain. Appears in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' in ambiguous reference to a kind of sea creature (possibly sharks{{R:Daijirin}} or crocodiles). The sense of {{m|en|crocodile}} clearly appears in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' dictionary (938) with an explanation of “having four legs like a turtle and a three-foot mouth with sharp teeth.” Various theories exist regarding the term's origin, such as an alteration of {{m|ja|鬼|tr=oni||demon, devil}}, or an abbreviation of {{m|ja|海主|tr=watanushi||sea master, sea god}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鰐の口|わに の くち}}: "the alligator's mouth" → an [[extremely]] [[dangerous]] [[place]] or [[situation]]
* {{ja-r|鰐口|わにぐち}}: a [[crocodile]]'s or [[alligator]]'s mouth; a terrible [[rumor]]; someone with a physically large mouth; a wide [[bronze]] [[bell]] rung with a [[rope]] and hung at [[shrine]]s; part of a Japanese [[saddle]]; {{qualifier|slang}} the female [[genitalia]]; {{qualifier|slang}} a coin [[purse]]
* {{ja-r|鰐口草|わにぐちそう}}: a [[perennial]] [[plant]] in the [[lily]] family, possibly related to ''[[Polygonatum]]''
* {{ja-r|鰐鮫|わにざめ}}: an [[alligator]] or [[crocodile]]; a [[shark]] or other large dangerous fish
* {{ja-r|鰐千鳥|わにちどり}}: the [[crocodile bird]] or {{w|Egyptian plover}}, ''[[Pluvianus aegyptius]]''
* {{ja-r|鰐足|わにあし}}: [[knock knee]]s, [[bowleg]]s
* {{ja-r|鰐皮|わにがわ}}: [[crocodile]] or [[alligator]] [[skin]] or [[hide]]
* {{ja-r|鰐鱶|わにぶか}}: an [[alligator]] or [[crocodile]]; a [[shark]] or other large dangerous fish
{{der-bottom}}
